Our Bible Verses for Today:

Paul says, "I care very little if I am judged by you or 
any human court; indeed, I do not even judge myself...

My conscience is clear, but that does not make me
innocent. It is the Lord who judges me...

Therefore judge nothing before the appointed time;
wait till the Lord comes. He will bring light on what is 
hidden in darkness and will expose the motives of 
men's hearts. At that time each will receive his praise
from God..." (I Cor.4:3-5)

Our Lesson for Today:

It is tempting to judge fellow Christians, evaluating whether
or not they are good followers of Christ. But only God knows 
a person's heart, and He is the only one with the right to judge...

Paul's warning to the Corinthians should also warn us. We are
to confront those who are sinning (see. Cor. 5:12, 13), but we 
need to remember we must not judge who is a better servant 
of Christ. When you judge someone you are really considering 
yourself as better, and that is an arrogant assumption...

Our Prayer for Today:
Dear Heavenly Father, help me to never make the assumption
that I am better than other people. Help me to leave the judging 
up to you...Protect all my e-mail friends from Satan's temptations...Amen

You are in the prayers of two who care...
Keep looking up for godly wisdom...
Pastor Al & Marcie Sather

Our Bible Verses for Today:

Paul said, "Dear brothers and sisters, I have used Apollos and
myself to illustrate what I've been saying. If you pay attention to
the Scriptures, you won't brag about one of your leaders at the
expense of another...

What makes you better than anyone else? what do have that 
God hasn't given you? And if all that you have is from God, why
boast as though you have accomplished something on your own?"

Our Lesson From These Verses Today:

How easy it is for us to become attached to certain spiritual leaders.
When someone has helped us, it is natural for us to feel loyal...

But Paul warns against having such pride in our favorite leaders, 
because that will cause division in the church...

Any true spiritual leader is a representative of Christ and has nothing
to offer that God hasn't given him or her...

Don't let your loyalty cause strife, slander, or broken relationships.
Make sure that your deepest loyalties are to Christ and not to his
human agents...

Those who spend more time debating church leadership than declaring 
Christ's message don't have the mind of Christ...

Dear Heavenly Father, I do dearly thank you for the 
spiritual leaders here on earth that teach Your truths
to us, but help me to remember not to lift them to 
high. Instead Help me to remember it is You and
only You who are worthy of our praise...Amen.

Keep looking up, to our Great and Awesome God...
You are in the prayers of two who care...
Pastor Al & Marcie Sather

I have written to you not to associate with sexually immoral people ~

Not at all meaning the people of this world who are immoral, or

unbelievers ~ otherwise we could not carry out Christ's command

Christian, yet indulges in sins that are forbidden in Scriptures...

person harms others for whom Christ died and dims the image of God
in himself or herself...

To do so would distort the picture of Christ it is to present to the world...

Church leaders must be ready to correct, in love, for the sake of spiritual unity.

for You. Bless all who read this devotion with good health and
safety. Be with those who mourn the lose of a loved one and give
strength to those who are undergoing cancer treatments...Amen.

ourselves...

in Jesus name...Amen.
